components.description: Translates as meaning complimentary, or free of charge. For example, a drink that is given "on the house" to a regular customer.
components.title: Squared Katakana Sa

description: Translates as meaning complimentary, or free of charge. For example, a drink that is given "on the house" to a regular customer.
title: Squared Katakana Sa

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

bn:00105516a: Of or relating to or characteristic of Japan or its people or their culture or language
Of, relating to, or derived from Japan, its language, or culture.

bn:00103572a: Used of the language of the deaf

bn:00924608n: A Japanese syllabary used when writing words borrowed from foreign languages other than Chinese, specific names of plants and animals and other jargon, or to emphasize a word or phrase.
A general term for the syllabic Japanese scripts hiragana, katakana, as well as the old system known as man'y?gana.
Katakana is a Japanese syllabary, one component of the Japanese writing system along with hiragana, kanji, and in some cases the Latin script.
A syllabary used in the Japanese language and one component of the Japanese writing system along with hiragana and kanji.

bn:00033939n: A charge fixed by law for services of public officers or for use of a privilege under control of government.
Monetary payment charged for professional services.
A fee is the price one pays as remuneration for services.
Price one pays as remuneration for services
A monetary payment charged for professional services.
A fixed charge for a privilege or for professional services

bn:00075652n: A symbol is an object that represents, stands for, or suggests an idea, visual image, belief, action, or material entity.
Symbols are things such as particular forms or marks which represent some sort of information, an idea, a physical entity or a process but is distinct from it.
In programming, a name that represents a register, an absolute value, or a memory address (relative or absolute).
A character or glyph representing an idea, concept or object.
One or a few characters, a picture or an other concrete representation of an idea, a concept and the like.
An object that represents, stands for, or suggests an idea, belief, action, or material entity
An arbitrary sign (written or printed) that has acquired a conventional significance
Something that represents an idea, a process, or a physical entity
